channel.title: Comments on: European Parliament Petition on Elsevier and the Open Science Monitor

item.title: By: Elsevier and the Open Science Monitor: Where are we at? - Green Tea and Velociraptors
item.dc:creator: Elsevier and the Open Science Monitor: Where are we at? - Green Tea and Velociraptors
item.description: […] one of the chief opponents to the progress of Open Science, will be helping to monitor the future of Open Science in Europe. Metaphors about foxes and hen-houses have been flying […]
item.content:encoded: […] one of the chief opponents to the progress of Open Science, will be helping to monitor the future of Open Science in Europe. Metaphors about foxes and hen-houses have been flying […]

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/european-parliament-petition-on-elsevier-and-the-open-science-monitor/#comment-3075">Ronald Drimmel</a>.
Thanks, Ronald! Yeah, a few people have mentioned this now - please accept my apologies. I have forwarded this to the Secretariat now, but I don't think there's much that they can do.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ronald Drimmel.

Thanks, Ronald! Yeah, a few people have mentioned this now – please accept my apologies. I have forwarded this to the Secretariat now, but I don’t think there’s much that they can do.

item.title: By: Ronald Drimmel
item.dc:creator: Ronald Drimmel
item.description: Ugh. The EU site is clunky. First you have to register, then sign in, then search find the petition (keyword "Science" worked), then click "support" two times.. But I made it through the hoops! Thanks for the immense effort to get this started.
item.content:encoded:
Ugh. The EU site is clunky. First you have to register, then sign in, then search find the petition (keyword “Science” worked), then click “support” two times.. But I made it through the hoops!
Thanks for the immense effort to get this started.

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/european-parliament-petition-on-elsevier-and-the-open-science-monitor/#comment-3069">Damien Jacques</a>.
Hey Damien, thanks for these kind comments. I do think that Elsevier and the Lisbon Council have acted shamefully over this, and I also do not feel that the EC has the best interests of the wider public in mind over scientific matters. I honestly have no idea how it will end - I see a lot of angry people at Elsevier and their kin, but not many people doing anything about it. The PDF link is broken atm, but yes, I will add it when it's fixed, good idea!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Damien Jacques.

Hey Damien, thanks for these kind comments. I do think that Elsevier and the Lisbon Council have acted shamefully over this, and I also do not feel that the EC has the best interests of the wider public in mind over scientific matters. I honestly have no idea how it will end – I see a lot of angry people at Elsevier and their kin, but not many people doing anything about it.
The PDF link is broken atm, but yes, I will add it when it’s fixed, good idea!

item.title: By: Damien Jacques
item.dc:creator: Damien Jacques
item.description:
Hi Jon,
I have just caught up on the events that followed the publication of the article in the Guardian (thanks for the summary at the beginning of the article). It has become a textbook case on how to stifle opponents by discriminating against them, the balance of power between private and public and the functioning of our European democratic institutions... I wonder how this is all going to end.
Can I suggest that you add a direct link to the pdf of the petition in your article?
I wish I had half your talent and will. Thank you for the hard work done for the (often thankless) research community.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jon,

I have just caught up on the events that followed the publication of the article in the Guardian (thanks for the summary at the beginning of the article). It has become a textbook case on how to stifle opponents by discriminating against them, the balance of power between private and public and the functioning of our European democratic institutions… I wonder how this is all going to end.

Can I suggest that you add a direct link to the pdf of the petition in your article?

I wish I had half your talent and will.
Thank you for the hard work done for the (often thankless) research community.
